Comments_List: An excellent review of macro labor workhorse models: search, matching and sorting with a lot of applications.

Broad range of papers and models, good in-depth discussion of the math behind the models. Research methods, how to approach question, datasets to use.  Good foundation for reading labor/macro papers in the future.
Lots of labor models. We read some nice papers and also practiced with hjb equations.

A well-organized course.
Assignments challenge students for different skills.
I received a lot of guidance from the professors.

Good lectures, good slides, nice to get really thorough treatment of theory.  I thought it was a shame we only spent 1-2 classes on applications in the 2nd quarter, the papers we discussed were some of the most interesting of the entire course to me and it would be nice to have more applications in both quarters.  Then again, time is limited and maybe it's more worthwhile to cover all the theory in class and we can read the applications independently later.
Every student interested in macro, labor should take this class
Yes, anyone interested in macro or labor would benefit, ideas also seem useful for trade.
If you want to do macro, you should take it. But the class is a big commitment if you are not considering macro.
